intro: Pilosella impallescens, commonly known as the silverleaf pilosella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
